00022 #include "chipstream/EmGenderCelListener.h"

00030 using namespace std;
00031 using namespace affx;
00032 using namespace affymetrix_fusion_io;
00033 
00034 /** 
00035  * Constructor.
00036  * @param chrXpSets - Vector of chrX probesets that are not in the
00037  * pseudo autosomal region and should be haploid in males and
00038  * diploid in females.
00039  */
00040 EmGenderCelListener::EmGenderCelListener(std::vector<ProbeListPacked> &chrXpSets,
00041                                          double k ,
00042                                          double emThresh ,
00043                                          double emCutOff ,
00044                                          double genderCutOff  
00045                                          ) : m_ChrXProbeSets(chrXpSets),
00046                                              m_K(k),
00047                                              m_EmThresh(emThresh),
00048                                              m_EmCutOff(emCutOff),
00049                                              m_GenderCutOff(genderCutOff)
00050 {
00051   m_GenderName="em-cluster-chrX-het-contrast";
00052   m_GenderDescription="EM clustering of chrX contrast values from SNP probesets";
00053 
00054   declareMetric(m_GenderName + "_gender",ChipSummary::Metric::String);
00055   declareMetric(m_GenderName + "_gender_chrX_het_rate",ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00056 }
00057 
00058 void EmGenderCelListener::CallGender(const std::vector<double>& contrast,
00059                                      affx::Gender &gender,
00060                                      double &hcr) {
00061   CallGender(contrast, 0.05f, 0.5f, 0.1f, gender, hcr);
00062 }
00063 
00064 /** 
00065  * Loop through the probesets provided and calculate a contrast value
00066  * for each one using the median of PM probes for A allele and B
00067  * allele.
00068  * @param cel - Cel File to get data from.
00069  * @param chrXProbeSets - Probesets to process (should be chrX non-pseudo autosomal).
00070  * @param contrastValues - Contrast values vector to be filled in.
00071  */
00072 void EmGenderCelListener::fillInContrastValues(FusionCELData *cel, 
00073                                                std::vector<ProbeListPacked> &chrXProbeSets, 
00074                                                std::vector<double> &contrastValues, 
00075                                                double k) {
00076   contrastValues.clear();
00077   contrastValues.reserve(chrXProbeSets.size());
00078   for(int psIx = 0; psIx < chrXProbeSets.size(); psIx++) {
00079     const ProbeSet *ps =  ProbeListFactory::asProbeSet(chrXProbeSets[psIx]);
00080     contrastValues.push_back(CalculateEMContrast(cel, ps, k));
00081     delete ps;
00082   }
00083 }
00084 
00085 /**
00086  * Calculate contrast values
00087  */
00088 double EmGenderCelListener::CalculateEMContrast(FusionCELData* cel, const ProbeSet* ps, const double k) {
00089     float Amedian = -1, Bmedian = -1;
00090     bool medianOk = alleleMedians(cel, ps, Amedian, Bmedian);
00091     if(!medianOk || Amedian <= 0 || Bmedian <= 0) {
00092       Err::errAbort("EmGenderCelListener::fillInContrastValues() - Warning. alleleMedian() failed for probeset: " + ToStr(ps->name));
00093     }
00094     double contrast = -2, strength = -2;
00095     ContrastCentersStretch(k, Amedian, Bmedian, contrast, strength);
00096     if(fabs(contrast) > 1) {
00097       Err::errAbort("EmGenderCelListener::fillInContrastValues() - Can't have abs(contrast) > 1 for probeset: " + ToStr(ps->name));
00098     }
00099     return contrast;
00100 }
00101 
00102 /** 
00103  * Process another cel files worth of data.
00104  * @param cel - Filehandle to open cel file.
00105  */
00106 void EmGenderCelListener::newChip(FusionCELData *cel) {
00107   double hcr;
00108   std::vector<ChipSummary::Metric> metrics;
00109   m_SummaryStats.push_back(metrics);
00110   m_CelNames.push_back(cel->GetFileName());
00111 
00112   vector<double> contrastValues;
00113   fillInContrastValues(cel, m_ChrXProbeSets, contrastValues, m_K);
00114   // use the default thresholds.
00115   Gender gender = UnknownGender;
00116   CallGender(contrastValues,m_EmThresh,m_EmCutOff,m_GenderCutOff,gender,hcr);
00117   m_Genders.push_back(gender);
00118 
00119   m_SummaryStats[m_CelNames.size()-1].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(m_GenderName + "_gender",affx::getGenderString(gender)));
00120   m_SummaryStats[m_CelNames.size()-1].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(m_GenderName + "_gender_chrX_het_rate",hcr));
00121   setValid(true);
00122 }
00123 
00124 /**
00125 * @brief EM-based gender calling algorithm, call gender on a single sample
00126 */
00127 void EmGenderCelListener::CallGender(const std::vector<double>& contrast,
00128                                      const double em_thresh,
00129                                      const double em_cutoff,
00130                                      const double gender_cutoff,
00131                                      affx::Gender &gender,
00132                                      double &hcr) {
00133     CEMSeed seed;
00134     seed.setMu(-0.66f, 0.0f, 0.66f);
00135     seed.setSigma(0.1f, 0.1f, 0.1f);
00136     seed.setWeight(0.33f, 0.34f, 0.33f);
00137     seed.setMinMu(-2.0f, -.05f, .25f);
00138     seed.setMinSigma(0.02f, 0.02f, 0.02f);
00139     seed.setMaxMu(-.25f, .05f, 2.0f);
00140     seed.setMaxSigma(.3f, .3f, .3f);
00141 
00142     CPrimeEM em;
00143     em.setData(contrast);
00144     em.setThreshold(em_thresh);
00145     em.EMEstimate(seed);
00146     CEMEst* pEst = em.getEMEstimates();
00147     int nAA = count_if(pEst->m_class.begin(),pEst->m_class.end(),bind2nd(equal_to<int>(),0));
00148     int nBB = count_if(pEst->m_class.begin(),pEst->m_class.end(),bind2nd(equal_to<int>(),2));
00149     int nAB = count_if(pEst->m_class.begin(),pEst->m_class.end(),bind2nd(equal_to<int>(),1));
00150     hcr=-1;
00151     if(nAA+nBB+nBB > 0 && float(nAA+nAB+nBB)/pEst->m_class.size() > em_cutoff) {
00152         hcr = float(nAB)/float(nAA+nAB+nBB);
00153         if(hcr < gender_cutoff)
00154             gender = affx::Male;
00155         else
00156             gender = affx::Female;
00157     } else
00158         gender = affx::UnknownGender;
00159 }
